numlitem.para: Remaining system is verified to be operative before each departure, and
Operations are limited to not more than three flight days before repair is made.

placard.para: Placard affected Stall Test switch "L (R) STALL WARNING INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: For an inoperative stall warning or autoslat function, check the stall warning BITE module on the P51 panel for fault indication. If each BITE does not begin with a "4", a fault indication is present. Perform proper maintenance (Ref. MM 27-32-00).

For a failed WEU power supply, check the Warning Electronics (WEU) Power Supply fault balls. If a fault ball is present, reset power supplies. If either power supply has failed, remove and replace (Ref. MM 31-51-00). Dispatch is not permitted with either power supply inoperative.

For the stickshaker which has failed the test or had a nuisance activation, open and collar the appropriate stickshaker circuit breaker on P11 overhead panel (stickshaker - L (11C11); stickshaker - R (11J20)).
For a nuisance autoslat activation perform the following:
Open WARN ELEX A (11J33) and WARN ELEX B (11B18) circuit breakers on P11 overhead panel.

caution.para: STATIC SENSITIVE DEVICE. WEU CONTAINS DEVICES THAT CAN BE DAMAGED BY STATIC DISCHARGE. DO NOT HANDLE BEFORE READING PROCEDURE FOR HANDLING ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE SENSITIVE DEVICES (REF. MM 20-41-01).

numlitem.para: Open the WARNING ELECTRONICS UNIT P51 panel in the main E/E bay and remove the stall warning module for the affected system (system corresponding to the failed autoslat).
The slats should return to the intermediate position if they had remained extended after the test. If the slats remain extended after removing the stall warning module, dispatch is not permitted.
Protect and store the removed stall warning module so it can be returned when a new module is installed.

maintenance.para: If a "WARN ELEX" EICAS message is displayed or if the stall warning/autoslat system failed to operate properly, perform the following cockpit initiated test prior to each flight to verify that both WEU power supplies and at least one stall warning/autoslat system is operative. The stall warning/autoslat system is considered to be operative if it activates the stickshaker and autoslat when tested.

note.para: The speedbrakes/spoilers should be down prior to disconnecting power from the aircraft. Ensure control surface areas are clear of personnel and equipment before movement.

numlitem.para: Provide electrical power.
Pull WARN ELEX A (11J33) and WARN ELEX B (11B18) circuit breakers on the P11 overhead panel.
Reset WARN ELEX A circuit breaker.
Pressurize the left hydraulic system (Ref. Maintenance Manual 29-11-00).
Position the flap lever to the 1-unit detent. Verify that the flaps move to 1 (one) and the slats move to the intermediate (takeoff) position.
Hold both STALL test switches in the STALL position.
Verify that the one (or both) stickshaker(s) is operative and the slats move to the fully extended (landing) position.
Release the test switches.
Verify that the stickshaker(s) ceases to operate and the slats retract to the intermediate (takeoff) position.
Repeat steps 6 through 9 with the WARN ELEX B circuit breaker in and the WARN ELEX A circuit breaker pulled.
Reset both WARN ELEX A and B circuit breakers.
If the stickshaker failed to be operative, the WEU power supply or both stall warning modules are inoperative. Dispatch is not permitted (see MM 31-51-00).
